verses.roman:
tabe āmi-duṅhe tāre āliṅgana kailuṅ
'sādhu, dṛḍha-bhakti tomāra '--kahi' praśaṁsiluṅ

synonyms: tabe—at that time; āmi-duṅhe—both of us; tāre—him; āliṅgana kailuṅ—embraced; sādhu—very good; dṛḍha—very determined; bhakti—devotion; tomāra—your; kahi'-saying; praśaṁsiluṅ—we praised.
translation: "Upon hearing this, both of us embraced him and encouraged him by saying, 'You are a great saintly devotee, for your determination in devotional service is fixed.' In this way we both praised him.
